titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:14-0400

did.abstract: These papers are principally personal correspondence of a father and son who were prominent Pennsylvania-German citizens, each of whom represented his district in Congress. Correspondents of the elder Muhlenberg include William Bigler, Simon Cameron, William J. Duane, John Meredith Read, and Richard Rush, and concern Democratic politics and Lutheran church business. Correspondents of the younger Muhlenberg include Benjamin H. Brewster, George M. Dallas, John K. Kane, Robert M. Patterson, and Seth Salisbury. There is also a group of letters to and from Muhlenberg relating to his biography of General Peter Muhlenberg, and a volume of commissions.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Acquired from Mrs. Jesse Wagner, Reading, Pennsylvania, 1949. See table of contents for additional accession information.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: This microfilm was made possible by Mrs. Jesse Wagner and Frederick W. Nicolls, 1949.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Henry A. Muhlenberg was a politician and biographer.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Henry Augustus Philip Muhlenberg was a clergyman and politician.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in possession of Mrs. Jesse Wagner.

controlaccess.persname: Buchan, David Stewart Eskine, Earl of, 1742-1829
controlaccess.subject: Lutheran Church.
Political science.
